verses.verse: (Job Prays for Relief) (Ps 88.3, 4) “My spirit is broken; my days are extinct; the grave is ready for me.
(v 6|JOB 17:6; 1 Sam 1.6, 7) Surely there are mockers around me, and my eye dwells on their provocation.
(Ps 119.122; Prov 6.1) “Lay down a pledge for me with yourself; who is there who will give surety for me?
(Job 12.20) Since you have closed their minds to understanding, therefore you will not let them triumph.
(Lev 19.16; Job 11.20) Those who denounce friends for reward— the eyes of their children will fail.
(Job 30.9, 10) “He has made me a byword of the peoples, and I am one before whom people spit.
(Job 16.16) My eye has grown dim from grief, and all my members are like a shadow.
The upright are appalled at this, and the innocent stir themselves up against the godless.
(Job 22.30; Prov 4.18) Yet the righteous hold to their way, and they who have clean hands grow stronger and stronger.
But you, come back now, all of you, and I shall not find a sensible person among you.
(Job 7.6) My days are past; my plans are broken off, the desires of my heart.
They make night into day; ‘The light,’ they say, ‘is near to the darkness.’ (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Job 3.13) If I look for Sheol as my house, if I spread my couch in darkness,
(Job 21.26; 24.20; Ps 16.10) if I say to the Pit, ‘You are my father,’ and to the worm, ‘My mother’ or ‘My sister,’
(Job 7.6) where then is my hope? Who will see my hope?
(Job 3.17-19; Jon 2.6) Will it go down to the bars of Sheol? Shall we descend together into the dust?”
